headline: Palantir, Shopify, Norwegian Cruise Line: Earnings movers
summary: Wall Street is watching a number of earnings movers on Tuesday, Nov. 4, including Palantir (PLTR), Shopify (SHOP), and Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings (NCLH). Yahoo Finance Anchor Julie Hyman recaps the headlines in the latest Market Minute. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Why Royal Caribbean (RCL) Stock Is Down Today
summary: Shares of cruise vacation company Royal Caribbean (NYSE:RCL) fell 5% in the morning session after its peer Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings reported third-quarter revenue that fell short of expectations, sparking a sector-wide sell-off. Norwegian posted revenue of $2.94 billion, which missed analysts' forecasts of $3.02 billion. The news sent shares of Norwegian down, and rivals Royal Caribbean and Carnival Corp. also fell in sympathy. Adding to the concerns, Norwegian guided its fourth-quarter pr

headline: Norwegian Cruise Stock Sinks After Earnings Beat. What’s Worrying Wall Street.
summary: Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings  stock fell sharply Tuesday even after the cruise operator beat earnings estimates.  Adjusted earnings of $1.20 a share topped the $1.16 consensus among analysts polled by FactSet.  The cruise operator now expects net yield to 2.3% to 2.4%, or 2.4% to 2.5% in constant currency, down from 2.5% previously.

content.title: Norwegian Cruise Stock Sinks After Earnings Beat. What’s Worrying Wall Street.
content.summary: Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings  stock fell sharply Tuesday even after the cruise operator beat earnings estimates.  Adjusted earnings of $1.20 a share topped the $1.16 consensus among analysts polled by FactSet.  The cruise operator now expects net yield to 2.3% to 2.4%, or 2.4% to 2.5% in constant currency, down from 2.5% previously.

headline: Norwegian Cruise Line falls as revenue misses estimates despite record quarter
summary: Investing.com -- Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. (NYSE:NCLH) reported record third-quarter revenue of $2.94 billion on Monday, but shares tumbled over 8% at the open on Tuesday as the figure fell short of analyst expectations of $3.03 billion.

content.title: Norwegian Cruise Line falls as revenue misses estimates despite record quarter
content.summary: Investing.com -- Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. (NYSE:NCLH) reported record third-quarter revenue of $2.94 billion on Monday, but shares tumbled over 8% at the open on Tuesday as the figure fell short of analyst expectations of $3.03 billion.

headline: Norwegian Cruise Line: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: MIAMI (AP) — Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. (NCLH) on Tuesday reported third-quarter profit of $419.3 million. The Miami-based company said it had profit of 86 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs and stock option expense, came to $1.20 per share.

content.title: Norwegian Cruise Line: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: MIAMI (AP) — Norwegian Cruise Line Holdings Ltd. (NCLH) on Tuesday reported third-quarter profit of $419.3 million. The Miami-based company said it had profit of 86 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs and stock option expense, came to $1.20 per share.

headline: Norwegian Cruise Line (NYSE:NCLH) Misses Q3 Revenue Estimates, Stock Drops
summary: Cruise company Norwegian Cruise Line (NYSE:NCLH) missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q3 CY2025 as sales rose 4.7% year on year to $2.94 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.20 per share was 3.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
